answer_html: Hence, the correct answer is \(\displaystyle -\frac12 \ln|4-x^2|\), which is (iv).
answer_latex:
Hence, the correct answer is $\displaystyle -\frac12 \ln|4-x^2|$, which
is (iv).
hints_html:
Use a substitution to simplify the integral.

Use the substitution \(\displaystyle u = 4-x^2\).
hints_latex: Use a substitution to simplify the integral.
hints_raw:
Use a substitution to simplify the integral.
Use the substitution <math> \displaystyle u = 4-x^2 </math>.
question: 1 (b)
sols_html:
Let \(u = 4-x^2\). Then \(du = -2xdx\)

\(\int \frac{x}{4-x^2} = \int \frac{-du}{2u}\)

Take the constant \(\frac{-1}{2}\) out of the integral

\(\int \frac{x}{4-x^2} = \int \frac{-du}{2u} = \frac{-1}{2}\int \frac{-du}{2u} = \frac{-\ln|u|}{2}\)

Substitute back \(u = 4-x^2\) to get

\(\int \frac{x}{4-x^2} = \frac{-\ln|4-x^2|}{2}\)

Hence, the correct answer is \(\displaystyle -\frac12 \ln|4-x^2|\), which is (iv).
sols_latex:
Let $u = 4-x^2$. Then $du = -2xdx$

$\int \frac{x}{4-x^2} = \int \frac{-du}{2u}$

Take the constant $\frac{-1}{2}$ out of the integral

$\int \frac{x}{4-x^2} = \int \frac{-du}{2u} = \frac{-1}{2}\int \frac{-du}{2u} = \frac{-\ln|u|}{2}$

Substitute back $u = 4-x^2$ to get

$\int \frac{x}{4-x^2} = \frac{-\ln|4-x^2|}{2}$

Hence, the correct answer is $\displaystyle -\frac12 \ln|4-x^2|$, which
is (iv).
sols_raw:
Let <math>u = 4-x^2</math>. Then <math>du = -2xdx</math>

<math>\int \frac{x}{4-x^2} = \int \frac{-du}{2u} </math>

Take the constant <math>\frac{-1}{2}</math> out of the integral 

<math>\int \frac{x}{4-x^2} = \int \frac{-du}{2u} = \frac{-1}{2}\int \frac{-du}{2u} = \frac{-\ln|u|}{2}</math>

Substitute back <math> u = 4-x^2 </math> to get 

<math>\int \frac{x}{4-x^2} = \frac{-\ln|4-x^2|}{2}</math>

Hence, the correct answer is <math>\displaystyle -\frac12 \ln|4-x^2|</math>, which is (iv).
statement_html:
Multiple Choice Question: Select ONE correct answer (i), (ii), (iii), (iv), or (v).

(b) An antiderivative of

\[\begin{aligned} \frac{x}{4-x^2}\end{aligned}\]

is

(i)   \(\displaystyle {} \frac14 \arctan(x/2)\)

(ii)   \(\displaystyle {} \frac12 x\arctan(x/2)\)

(iii)   \(\displaystyle {} \frac12 \ln\frac{|2+x|}{|2-x|}\)

(iv)   \(\displaystyle {} -\frac12 \ln |4-x^2|\)

(v)   \(\displaystyle {} \frac12 \ln |4-x^2|\)
statement_raw:
Multiple Choice Question: Select '''ONE''' correct answer ''(i)'', ''(ii)'', ''(iii)'', ''(iv)'', or ''(v)''.

'''(b)''' An antiderivative of
:<math>
\frac{x}{4-x^2}
</math>
is

:''(i)'' &nbsp; <math>\displaystyle{} \frac14 \arctan(x/2) </math>

:''(ii)'' &nbsp; <math>\displaystyle{} \frac12 x\arctan(x/2) </math> 

:''(iii)'' &nbsp; <math>\displaystyle{} \frac12 \ln\frac{|2+x|}{|2-x|} </math> 

:''(iv)'' &nbsp; <math>\displaystyle{} -\frac12 \ln |4-x^2| </math> 

:''(v)'' &nbsp; <math>\displaystyle{} \frac12 \ln |4-x^2| </math>
